primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The restoration of a sick and separated society to its 'Father's house' through the adoption of the 'society of the cross' over the 'society of the crown'.

tekstueel_bewijs: we have forgotten who we are
we are back at our Father's house

object.identificatie: A new sense of spirituality and a just world (The Father's House)
tekstueel_bewijs: infusion of a new sense of spirituality
dreaming of a fairer, more just world
authentic word and will and way of God
the Lord has been our dwelling place

ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as the Subject who must return.

helper.identificatie: The Early Christian Example / The Spirit of Righteousness
tekstueel_bewijs: the early Christians were the society of the cross
power of the spirit of righteousness
helper.rol_van_god: God is the destination (Object/Sender) rather than the active Subject of the verbs.

tekstueel_bewijs: rapacity and sinfulness of our society's standards
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is a systemic, 'hard-bitten' culture that negates human value based on skin color.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The historical struggle between Rome and the Early Church as a template for the current struggle.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: Early Christians
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program serves as the 'Savoir-faire' (knowledge) for the primary subject.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.subject_naar_object: We → Returning to the Father's House

voorbeelden_god_subject: the Lord has been our dwelling place
voorbeelden_mens_subject: we have forgotten who we are
we are back at our Father's house

voorbeelden: destined never to be whole again until we are back
dreaming of a fairer, more just world
needs the infusion of a new sense of spirituality

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon is a recruitment of the will. It assumes that if the 'dream' is clear enough, the subject will move.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Rome/Modernity) to ~S1 (Sickness/Separation) to S1 (The Cross).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is found in the 'Return' of the prodigal to the Father's house.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Very high; S2 is seen as a systemic sickness.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While theologically grounded in the Cross, the actantial structure is 'Synergistic-Exemplarist'. Man is the subject of the return, though God is the destination.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: setting ourselves to his will and his way

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: needs the infusion of a new sense of spirituality

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The early Christians are used as the actantial model for the current movement.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: God, who raised Christ (S), overcomes the 'Society of the Crown' (O) to bring us home.

identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Sanctification/Justice is framed as a human response to a divine memory.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: Highly coherent; the metaphor of the 'Prodigal' perfectly bridges the social and spiritual programs.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'we have forgotten' (human failure) and 'needs the infusion' (divine gift).

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: The meeting of two mutually contradictory ways of life... power of the spirit of righteousness.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit provides the 'power of righteousness' as a resource for the Subject.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Severe; described as a 'sickness' and 'internal disease'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon functions as a 'Call to Action' where the hearer is the Subject and God is the Sender/Object.

subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Make God the one who finds the prodigal.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'until we are back', use 'until the Father runs to meet us on the road'.

identificatie_herstel.strategie: Emphasize the 'infusion' as a gift rather than a task.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Focus on how the Cross provides the power that the 'crown' lacks.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.probleem: The 'Likeness of Resurrection' (Program 1) is treated as a result of our 'setting ourselves' (Program 2).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A powerful rhetorical piece that uses structural exemplarism to mobilize a movement, though it leans heavily on human agency in its deep actantial structure.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorically, this is a masterpiece of persuasion; semiotically, it reveals a synergistic engine.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis of Romans 6 usually emphasizes the passive 'being buried', while this sermon emphasizes the active 'setting ourselves'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that 'The Father's House' is the Object of desire, but the 'Prodigal' (the hearer) is the one doing the heavy lifting of the journey.

appendices.notities: The sermon is highly effective for social mobilization because it places the 'Subject' role firmly in the hands of the oppressed.
